website_summaries.verdict: This basic potting bench has a natural wood finish for painting or staining at home.
pros: Features a lower shelf below the main workstation and a small upper shelf above it, plus a drawer for storing tools
cons: Not as sturdy as high-end benches

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Arrived securely boxed. Fit and finish are excellent; had no problem whatsoever assembling it with only a screwdriver. Finished piece looks like it would cost much more. It's gratifying to see that my labor added so much value! I'm going to fit it with a small bar sink so it can double duty as a potting bench as well as an outdoor bar. Update: the potting bench, after taking stain and spar varnish, and equipped with a bar sink & faucet, now doubles as our patio bar!
customer_reviews.author: geezboyz

customer_reviews.title: I loved it but not exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I loved it but not exactly what I wanted. The one I wanted was over 400 dollars, so I improvised with 5 cans of spray paint and 14 dollars worth of tile. I love it and now it fits perfectly with the exterior of my house. Oh and much heavier😊 Now to put some herbs and plants on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great potting bench for the money!
customer_reviews.text: My potting bench arrived yesterday and I dreaded putting it together. It was easy peasy. People said a half an hour but I think it's closer to 15 minutes. It is lightweight, which I like because it was me myself and I Who put it together. I did run out and get two cans of clear acrylic spray paint. It's all set up and ready to go. It's just what I was looking for and the price was great. It's on my back porch now, here's a photo.
customer_reviews.author: Kate PA

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Perfect to have near my raised garden
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Perfect to have near my raised garden. Great quality at a fair price. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Gammill

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great value and great quality. I keep this bench inside because I am worried about it getting wet outside. It looks pretty and is also functional. The only negative about this bench is the bench above the drawer has open slats from the wood therefore dirt and anything else falls into the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mozolic

customer_reviews.title: Suprising Product for the Money
customer_reviews.text: We didn't expect much for $75. plus shipping. Therefore we were pleasently suprised with the quality of the planting bench, ease of assembly, quality of the wood & hardware. Prior to assembly we treated the various wood pieces with Water Seal to assist in longevity. Assembly time was less than 30 minutes including a cup of coffee. All in all, I do believe we'll order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Westech

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had read the reviews before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said drills hole do not match up, the back trellis is slanting down by about 2 inches. We are going to need to redrill holes and adjust. On the support posts the screws split the wood, like another reviewer said wood is like balsa. The time and effort I have into it and having thrown the packing away it is too late to return however I an really disappointed. As others have mentioned I do not think it will weather well despite being for outdoors. I plan on adding varnish. Also someone mentioned it is not very sturdy and would not handle a bag of potting soil and I agree.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy Workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Shoddy and sloppy workmanship. Pieces arrived securely in the shipping box. Instructions were fine. But the pieces of wood were crap. Knots (making it hard to drill through in precut holes). Some holes were not routed in the correct positions, and some precut holes were over-routed. Had to jimmy rig three separate areas. Also, they split three of the small slats that were part of their preassemble, and then glued them before shipping. Looks horrible. They obviously don’t care that they sent out a damaged product to their customer. That’s just lazy. Do not recommend this product. Spend a little more money and get a better quality bench. This is not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L

customer_reviews.title: Parts availibility
customer_reviews.text: This unit remained unpacked in my garage for some time. When I opened it, the box contained no hardware. I contacted the company. I knew it was out of warranty, but they are still selling the product, so I hoped I could purchase the missing hardware. I did not expect it to be free. However, after the warranty expires, it is their policy not to sell replacement parts even with a charge. This policy is arbitrary and senseless. It's a perfect way to eliminate repeat customers. Expensive firewood!
customer_reviews.author: blp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Affordable Potting Bench
customer_reviews.text: We easily assembled the bench and put a weather coating on it just in time to set it out in our December rain storms. Tender flowering plants are taking shelter on it, and it is easy to drape a frost cover over the bench and them. The design is beautiful, the wood is sturdy, and the working surface height is just right. Extremely pleased with this item!
customer_reviews.author: Chalyse

customer_reviews.title: You suck
customer_reviews.text: I would like to start with they changed the design,it’s nothing like the pictures. My wife and I had to adjust and make it work for her. Sad that I paid for this crap. We only kept it because of the hassle to send back,the box had been taped up like crazy. I would not recommend this product. I was going to build one myself from 2x4, I am sure it would have been better. This is what I get for buying from the internet. Should have just built my own from my own wood.
customer_reviews.author: tyhuddleston

customer_reviews.title: WOOD POTTING BENCH
customer_reviews.text: This potting bench is sooo much more than I expected.....easy to assemble, good looking ....the quality is excellent...could be used for outdoor mini bar...I highly recommend this bench....mar
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Rader

customer_reviews.title: Bloom where you are planted!
customer_reviews.text: At age 66, newly retired and now in a one-level home, it seemed time to make my spring planting a little easier on the back, knees, etc. This bench was a terrific choice--easy to put together by myself(handy electric screwdriver), very simple instructions and light enough to move easily. And most of all--looks fabulous on the patio and will moonlight to serve snacks, drinks and so forth. Took one reviewers instructions and sprayed a coat of satin Rustoleum.....not sure how it will weather out in the sun and rain, but will cover it for our nasty northern Mn winters :) You should not be disappointed with this purchase.......p.s.........my drawer is on the left side..........no matter........
customer_reviews.author: S. Mescher

customer_reviews.title: A Twist in Design, no holes for screws.
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. Nice Potting Bench...! Instructions appeared to be easy until I got to the back board on top. Some of the holes weren't drilled in the right spots to accommodate the screws. I managed to get it all put together but not in the configuration of the photo of the unit. Actually what I ended up with by using the available holes I found worked better by raising the back board higher from the bench top. Works for me. I'm currently using the bench as a temporary cooking station.
customer_reviews.author: CanonUserVTTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good, small potting table
customer_reviews.text: It arrived as promised and was complete and in good condition. It is very light - not hardwood. Assembly was fairly easy- just be sure to study the drawings carefully and then study again before assembling, or you may be assembling some portions more than once. There are no written instructions just a drawing to guide you. Easy enough just take your time. I put 4 coats of spar varnish on the table when I finished assembling it just to reinforce the weather proofing. It should be able to stand up to winter weather in the PNW. We wanted a small potting table and this one works well for us. It will reside out side under partial cover.
customer_reviews.author: bobwilly

customer_reviews.title: Nice potting bench
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Was very easy to put together but in retrospect, I wish I had used wood glue as I think it would be a little sturdier. Seems to be holding up pretty well outside, but it will probably need a coat of stain at some point. The drawer is pretty useless as water, dirt, etc ends up in there unless you fabricate something to keep it out. Bottom of drawer is starting to rot from water sitting in it, but I can fix that. Overall it's a decent bench and my wife hasn't complained a bit about it so if she's happy, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Don C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Potting Bench !
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition with ALL the screws, instructions, etc... Easy to install and has lasted me 5 years so far. I am delighted as I have kept this out in the snow and rain a couple of years and it has held up perfectly! The only thing I added was a brass knob for the drawer to make it even more attractive! I have also used this on my terrace for serving food items at a BBQ event. One neighbor and one friend have since bought this potting bench via Amazon as they thought that the item was great and the price was unbelievable for all you get. i HIGHLY recommend this potting bench !
customer_reviews.author: B. Hartford

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The directions were not very clear, very condensed poor drawing, and none of the screw holes lined up, I had to make my own. The one I received also did not match the photo, it was similar but not the same. Overall it is not very sturdy and the table portion is incredibly flimsy, could use support in the center. This will probably only last me a year tops. Was not weather proof, had to do it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa DiIenno

customer_reviews.title: good value but assembly difficult
customer_reviews.text: for the money, this was a good purchase it has served the purpose and is a good addition the drawer did not have a knob so i added one, drilling the hole was not easy!! crazy the drawer did not have a knob?? assembly was not easy, some of the markings were unclear, i actually assembled something incorrectly and had to take apart and redo, so that was quite annoying
customer_reviews.author: cgking90

customer_reviews.title: Potting bench
customer_reviews.text: So far the unit seems fine. I assembled it by myself and I’m not the most handy person in the world. I only made two mistakes where the screw came out of the wood. Don’t know if it’s just because I am inexperienced or a design flaw. But it looks great on my front porch. I’ve added planters and pumpkins because I am using it as a decorative piece rather than a functional one. We’ll see how it holds out after a Wisconsin winter.
customer_reviews.author: a medieval researcher

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.  Directions are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: So I gifted this product in christmas and waited til the next spring which was 2 days ago. Missing a piece. Now it's not under warranty and they wont replace it and now its junk or I'm forced to buy another or make a piece myself to fit. It looks like it would fall apart anyway. Also good luck if you dont have any building skills. Not weatherproof.
customer_reviews.author: Mihin

customer_reviews.title: Close enough ...
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to put together, it could be sturdier but for the price it’s fine. The drawer goes on the opposite side which isn’t clear in the instructions and it doesn’t fit well. But truly who’d want a drawer under a slatted top when you are using this as a potting bench. The drawer would be full of soil all the time.
customer_reviews.author: E. Dunagan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality by far
customer_reviews.text: It's ok! Not the best quality by far! The drawer is useless and should be removed, it's too small for any functional use and if you use this outdoors it will catch and hold water as the top has spaces between the slats Should not be used outdoor if you expect it to last more than 2 years It is made from wood, but material is light weight if it is exposed to heavy weather it won't last long
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Welch

customer_reviews.title: This potting bench is an excellent value for the price and it looks really nice ...
customer_reviews.text: This potting bench is an excellent value for the price and it looks really nice too!!! It was easy peasy to put together - I put mine together in about 30-40 minutes. I especially appreciated getting an extra screw or nut in the various sized packages in case one got lost you wouldn't need to run out to the store to complete the project! The package arrived as promised and was well packaged. The bubble wrap was especially useful to put the pieces on during the build. Nothing was too heavy or cumbersome to handle! Now I can put all my gardening things in one place!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Y

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one I ordered. First one was partially pre-assembled ...
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I ordered. First one was partially pre-assembled and coated in varnish. Outstanding value. Not so for the second one. Unfinished wood, not pre-assembled and the instructions are incomprehensible. It is also a slightly different size. I would not order this again, even though I gave the first one rave reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but doable
customer_reviews.text: I received this sooner than expected which was nice. It was fairly easy to assemble, however, the predrilled holes were way off. I had to drill new holes and center them, and ended up with excessive holes and in the front the wood cracked. One of the predrilled holes actually made the shelf chip. I’ll try and glue it w wood glue. Ill fill holes w wood putty. I’ll stain it as well. The holes look like hell. Another $10.00. If it last 2 Seasons I will be happy. Too much trouble to send back. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Blusparks

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little potting bench
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to build, and looks really nice on my porch. I used this jumbo cutting mat: ( to cover the area over the drawer and it protects it from rain perfectly. If the link doesn't work, the dimensions of the mat are 18x24 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Amber L.T .

customer_reviews.title: Quick to assemble, sound in structure.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it as a Mother's Day gift. It was easy to assemble. It smelled great (like cedar). It was solid, sound and beautiful to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our use!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this table as a "grill table", not a potting table. We have it next to our grill so we can have a space to keep food and utensils, as well as storage for charcoal and such. It was easy to put together and sturdy. It smells amazing, as cedar usually does. We have witnessed it's ability to stand up to rain, but we bought a cover and think it will be ok! Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and it's very sturdy! I plan on putting a coat of weatherproof ...
customer_reviews.text: VERY well packed to protect wood and all parts!! I was very impressed! Assembled it in about 30 minutes, and it's very sturdy! I plan on putting a coat of weatherproof sealant on it like everyone else advises. I love it already! How was this only $70??? Very happy :) Update: There is one design for that I found. The contents of drawer have nothing protecting what's inside... meaning EVERYTHING spills through the slats of the table part into the drawer... soil, water (rain), everything. I'm thinking I may add thin piece of wood and attach it over the drawer or something.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Tarnow

customer_reviews.title: We love the finished product.
customer_reviews.text: I sealed all the wood pieces with an acrylic stain before assembly. The directions are not clear and I made a few mistakes using the wring bolts in the wrong places during assembly but these were easily corrected. Our finished product looks great, holds up well in the rain, and is sturdy even when filled with lots of pots. The drawer is not functional because dirt and moistures gets in easily.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Merchant

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Took about an hour to put together. It's very sturdy!! The tabletop is a bit shorter than what I was expecting (for reference, I'm 5'5" tall), but the bottom shelf has a ton of space for storage. I'm going to use plastic bins on the bottom shelf to store all my supplies for my succulents. It's NOT weatherproof. You need to apply a sealer to it to make it last outside. (Walmart sells sealer for $15). And no need to sand it down- its unfinished. Overall, it's very good quality and not too big or too small. The drawer is helpful too for smaller stuff.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Awful directions and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The table comes with picture directions, like most products now, but there are certain directions the pieces fit and this is not shown in the pictures. Plus, the screws came out the side of almost every area. My husband had to drill holes at an angle so the screws would go in properly. We also wood glued the connections as the screws were not enough to hold. Once we made all of the adjustments, the table was fine but it was only due the additional fortifications we made. NOT WORTH $90
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: So far I love this bench
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this bench. I put it together in about 15 minutes and have left it outdoors for the winter. (I live in the rocky mountains) Keeping my fingers crossed that it holds up, and I think it will. It hold most of my every day gardening tools and supplies. Nice looking
customer_reviews.author: comfortfoot

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: I really love how cute this bench is, it was relatively easy to put together. It's a great size, and a great height. I have already gotten so much use out of it. My only complaint is I may not have put the drawer in tight enough and it constantly falls out. One nice feature is that the drawer can drain, which is really great.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Renee @UsJohnsons

customer_reviews.title: Dog Grooming Table
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a dog grooming table. Storage below and a little in the drawer so works great to keep them at a comfortable height to groom my 3 miniature schnauzers. Since the table is slatted I have to put a throw rug on it so the dogs feet don't slip through it. The slatted feature also allows things to fall into the drawer or crawl or fly in the drawer. Last spring I had a sparrow make a nest in the drawer. But overall I love it. Once in a while I do use it for potting purposes! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Garden Bench for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It met my expectations, it was a little more difficult to assemble than some of the reviews, maybe it was just us. We did use an electric drill which made it easier, it is very appealing to the eye, very nice looking. I am concerned how it will hold up to the weather, I am going to watch it and maybe in a month put some sort of weather coating on it. It came quickly and was packed very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my kitty feedings!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as a place to feed my kitties on the lower level. Their food is off the ground and in the shade. Sometimes the kitties like to lay on top in the sun. I attach bags over it when it rains to protect their food when it rains. I'm thinking of getting a BBQ cover to put over it on rainy days that I cut a slit in for entrance, that way their food will stay dry and they have a place another out of the rain. Gotta be creative!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This took me a while to put together by myself but was so worth it. Basically you have to assemble everything yourself, the drawer wasn’t even preassembled. The instructions are super easy to follow though. There was one small wooden bracket that was broken, but contacting the manufacturer and getting a replacement was easy. Love this potting bench, perfect for what I need and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Stephani Ann

customer_reviews.title: Assembly, more time (than you think)  required
customer_reviews.text: Built it for my wife - takes awhile to assemble - take it slow. The shelf is somewhat of a joke - gotta get the upper fitting rails just right on it will fall out when pulling more than 1/2 way. Without the top covered, rain or spray will get into the drawer. I covered mine with a rubber mat placed on the top shelf area there the drawer is exposed If it is used outside - coat it with varnish or something similar
customer_reviews.author: JPK

customer_reviews.title: A really good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this potting bench in my basement so I don’t know how it would withstand the weather. But I really love it...it really helps me keep everything organized and accessible. It seems very sturdy...although there is weight restrictions for the bottom shelf. It was a good price and a good buy. My son put it together and said it was fairly easy...but the instructions were pictures, no dialogue. Some may find that frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cox

customer_reviews.title: Nice potting table, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect sized potting table to put inside my 10x12 greenhouse. The natural wood gives off a pleasant scent upon unpacking. I would say overall the table is sturdy and versatile( easy to customize if wanted). The bottom shelf is questionable on sturdiness if too much weight was directly in the center. Also, cat approves.
customer_reviews.author: Thorasaurus Rex

customer_reviews.title: Better directions for assembling required
customer_reviews.text: The pictures for assembling were inadequate. More markings are needed or directions to identify top and bottom for what I would call the legs would have been beneficial. I put the pieces together and the had to take apart and re-do. Side slats for screws are not thick enough and therefore the screws are either not in the wood or the wood splits.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia B. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely engineered, VERY EASY to put together and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely engineered, VERY EASY to put together and I don't consider myself very handy. It looks Great and seems well made! There are no written instructions, just pictures, so you MUST be careful to view the pictures carefully to get the legs in the correct position. All holes are pre-drilled and EXACTLY lined up with each part. Excellent value! This is only the 2nd item I've given 5 stars! (out of 12-15 reviews (2-1 stars, mostly 3 & 4 stars)! It's well designed and well built! Seems sturdy but haven't planted yet because of the bad weather here in California.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Well built and well finished . It’s very easy to assemble and extra parts were provided. You know that you are dealing with a thoughtful caring company!
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Wooden Outdoor Potting Bench
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this ! It came early. It is a quality bench, looks great and wonderful with my plants . I love the drawer, and everything about it!! A wonderful buy for my money. I may buy 1 more.
customer_reviews.author: Agent00Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very nice potting bench!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this potting bench! It matches the Outdoor Storage Shed I bought to sit beside it in my garden area. It is up against the sunroom windows and under the eave, but it does get rained on. Have not had any problems. I have bags of potting soil and clay pots stacked on the bottom shelf. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: kd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, cute bench
customer_reviews.text: Great little potting bench. Easy to assemble. I’m 74 and was able to assemble it in under an hour, by myself. The back Latrice part screw holes were not lined up correctly, easily corrected. An extra of each type of screw was enclosed good if you should lose one. All needed a little help with was making sure the screws were tight enough. The drawer slid right in, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time and easy assembly even for one person
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and easy assembly even for one person. The rating I gave is because it's listed as paintable but unless you want to sand down every piece you can't paint or stain it, very disappointed as I wanted to have this bench in white. Could use more than the two hooks that came with it and the top bench slate design allows dirt and stuff to fall into the drawer; off to the hardware store for hooks and a sheet of wood to cover the top bench.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not extremely sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this potting bench for my carport. My main intent was to have something to place cat food bowls up high so the neighbor's dog would not be able to eat all the cat food.....and to also use as a potting bench when needed. It was not the easiest thing to put together and the directions were confusing, but my boyfriend and I got it together after a couple hours. The wood is soft & overall it doesn't seem very sturdy, but for my purpose of holding food bowls it will do fine. The cats seem to really like it. I plan on applying a coat of sealer to hopefully make it last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: E Bright

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a little difficult because there were only drill holes on one side. It turned out that wasn't really a problem except when lining things up because the wood is very soft. It also smells a lot like pine. It is light weight and what I needed as an outdoor place to re-pot my plants. The sides of the drawer were very rough so it's definitely not a display piece.
customer_reviews.author: winterreader

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This potter's bench is nicer than I had anticipated. It's made from douglas fir. For a softwood it's fairly strong and durable. Fir is inexpensive and doesn’t stain very well (in my opinion). You absolutely can stain it, but it's ideally suited for painting. I plan to leave it how it is with its natural wood finish (I believe it's an oil based stain); it looks lovely. I like the little side drawer and pair of side hooks. I may add additional hooks on the other side because they're pretty handy dandy. It arrived quickly and thoughtfully packaged. All the hardware and clear instructions were included. This would make nice addition to any gardener's arsenal. The price was certainly right.
customer_reviews.author: OregoniansTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice sized bench but.....
customer_reviews.text: A nice sized bench. The assembly instructions were AWFUL and even after looking them up on their website were still hard to understand. The assembly marking numbers on the wood were hard to find. A sticker system would worried better. Some of the pre-drilled holes did not line up well and I had to redrill several to make things fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepers

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for the price. As far as assembly goes, the directions took some reviewing and a couple of times we had to redo some pieces. Also, we had to use a pocket knife to cut the drawer grooves to make the drawer slide easier. Once it was all done it felt pretty sturdy. I keep mine stored under the carport so I'm not sure of it being waterproof. All in all, I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl King

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat unstable
customer_reviews.text: I'm okay with this bench, however, would have been better if it had better instructions and perhaps longer screws. I live in the desert and it can get pretty windy out here. It's blown over a couple of times. Now I put potting soil in the bottom to anchor down.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: very easy to assemble the partially assembled components
customer_reviews.text: This was an exceptional gift for my wife. She loves it! If your wife is a gardener then don't miss this one guys. Very high quality, very easy to assemble the partially assembled components. Went together in about 15 minutes with simple tools. Its a really nice piece of furniture and now she is reluctant to put it in the garage where no one can see it. It might end up in our screened in front porch!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but a little frustrating to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy but lightweight and easy to move. Water beads off but not sure yet how it will hold up in super harsh weather. Ive put together tons of furniture pieces over the years, but assembly was pretty frustrating for this one, the instructions are made up of only tiny images with no distinct markings to tell how pieces need to be aligned. It took some trial and error, unscrewing and rearranging at times. The drawer works nicely, but be warned that any water or dirt will fall through the slats into it. Overall for the price it is a nice piece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. It was very much as advertised. Two watch-outs though. First, it is very soft wood. You will definitely need to seal or waterproof it if you want to keep it outdoors. Second, the part labels do not match the instructions. Thankfully the pictures and instructions are clear and keep this from being a real problem. But if you are not used to putting things together, watch out.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not Weatherproofed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The small amount of directions were confusing and everything was labed poorly. The wood has not been weatherproofed so unless you're looking for a DIY project, do not buy this. It's been raining for the last 2 weeks so this is still sitting inside waiting to be prepped for the outdoors. Yet the description states it's for the outdoors. Overall it looks nice and once I have it ready to live outdoors I think it will be a good piece, but it's definitely not the project I was expecting and I don't think I'd pay $80 for this again. Maybe $50-$60.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: we assembled this bench yesterday and it was pretty easy. I like how it looks like. I placed in outside for my garden supplies and pot new wall and it looks pretty neat and spacious for my garden items. We use olive oil on couple details for better sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Lola Vosfieva

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy potting table.
customer_reviews.text: I would not call this a bench. It has a lot of space for storing equipment for planting and it has a place to put my potted plants for propagation, and just out of the way. I like the drawer and the hooks on the side for holding tools or whatever. I don't know much about weatherproof because I have it protected from the elements.
customer_reviews.author: S. F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble if manufactured properly
customer_reviews.text: This should have been super easy to assemble. However, it was missing the routing groves from one off the back upright supports. Routed them out myself, but was definitely a quality oversight since every back upright support for this model should be identical. Unit is fairly level and reasonable sturdy. I wouldn't put very heavy items on this, but this can easily hold basic potting and seeding materials. I'll be interested to see how this maintains over the seasons. I have a feeling I may need to stain this within a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much! I have never put together anything and was thrilled at how easy it was. If I can do it, anyone can. everything fit exactly the way it was suppose to and it looks sweet on my balcony. Couldn't wait to get up this morning to see it. Had candles on it last night, very romantic. Thanks Best Choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lindamarie Todd

customer_reviews.title: Working bench
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful wood, easy to assemble and serves my purposes perfectly. The only problem with it is the little drawer, it will warp over time because of what it is made of. That should be a drawer made of metal or plastic with tiny holes in it so the water could drain out. I will probably redo the bottom of the drawer with a plastic one as I described. Much more practical. Otherwise great bench for working or to place some plants on to look attractive.
customer_reviews.author: "B"

customer_reviews.title: What you see is not what you get--and it takes HOURS to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Crossbeams are not the same in the package as shown on website. There are no assembly INSTRUCTIONS, per se, only some rough sketches of the parts and the hardware--most of which are not helpful at all. It takes two people several hours to assemble. The wood split during assembly. We had to use wood glue where the hardware split the wood. We don't know if it will hold up or not.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. DeGuire

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Some of the holes did not match up, had to redrill holes. Wood is VERY LIGHTWEIGHT- reminded my husband of balsa wood. I’m hoping it makes it through the summer. It looks cute in the backyard BUT will purchase another type of gardening bench that is sturdier when this one breaks down.
customer_reviews.author: EWWRN

customer_reviews.title: waste
customer_reviews.text: honestly a nightmare. didnt come with everything and didn’t realize until halfway through id have to go to the store to purchase more screws. not worth the price or the hassle. not every hole lines up and the directions are horrendous and lacking. took amost two hours to put together. dont buy it
customer_reviews.author: Emilee

customer_reviews.title: It looks great and seems to already have stain on it
customer_reviews.text: I did not have very high expectations for this bench because of the price point; I was deciding between this one and many others that were $130 and up. I decided to go with this one because of the quick shipping time and I was very impressed! It looks great and seems to already have stain on it. It was very easy to put together and looks great! It is holding up well and is loaded with potted herbs and is enduring a Michigan summer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Potting bench
customer_reviews.text: Really like this potting bench, it went together fast and has space to do all the potting of flowers and vegetables, plus it was a drawer, and hooks for tools, etc. I think it's great. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: This bench is really cute. I bought it to pot my plants on it on my patio. It was painful to put together. The directions are not very good. After it was together I was disappointed to see how unstable it is. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: weefaerie

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised with everything about this product.
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleasantly surprised at how quickly I received this, how well packed it was, how well labeled each part was, how well written the directions were, how well engineered it was (the holes lined up perfectly) and the quality of the materials (100 cedar). All this for a remarkably fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Beattie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice solid potting bench
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality of this potting bench. Solid, sturdy, and easy to put together. Cedar color and great room to work on potting plants and room to store various sized pots. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: You have to be very careful putting in the screw because the wood will split. Also, the holes are not lined up correctly so the screw will come out the side. I has a very strong smell that is not real cedar. Grossly overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: baton rouge 8

customer_reviews.title: Nice bench for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine bench for the price. Every part came varnished. There are two hook on one end and the hold my trowels well. It was very easy to build. The only down side is having a slatted surface over the drawer. When potting, dirt falls in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Alan McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Nice Potting bench, wrong part sent but made it work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little potting bench and I found it easy to assemble, minus one star because I received two of the same side panels (when they should be opposite), I had to drill holes for the screws in order for it to work. It would be noticeable if I didn't have the duplicate side against a wall. Other than that, it's a great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to fill in the blanks because of “Sloppy supplier!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, IF you get all the materials in the shipment. But they left out the drawer base. So and to schlepp to a hardware store, put out $6 for a ply board, cut it to size, varnish, and install with my own hardware. But that was easier and faster than registering a complaint with the manufacturer and getting the baseboard after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Half the hardware was missing!
customer_reviews.text: Half of the hardware was missing!! Half!!! Not good!!! It wasn’t very difficult to assemble, but with missing hardware, it took much longer than the 45 minute assembly time , as advertised! I waterproofed it after assembly. The wood soft. I’m hoping that it will last more than one year.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Braud

customer_reviews.title: it would be nice if they furnished wooden plugs to fill in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The drawer had a crack on the left side where they had assembled it. Instead of sending it back I just glued and clamped it together. The other issue is that the drawer itself is wide open to the elements. I modified that by screwing a piece of plexiglass on the underside of the top shelf above the drawer to keep water out of it. One other minor issue,it would be nice if they furnished wooden plugs to fill in the holes where the larger bolts go. I filled all of the holes with exterior wood putty to prevent water penetration. After these modifications my wife did like it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It isn't very sturdy, actually is pretty wobbly
customer_reviews.text: The quality is NOT what I was expecting based on the other reviews. I can't imagine putting anything really heavy on this. It isn't very sturdy, actually is pretty wobbly. I bought it after extensive research and based on other reviews and I am quite disappointed. The drawer is very flimsy and it was cut jagged and looks cheap/unfinished. The directions for assembly were not clear and it took us over an hour to assemble. We will use it as a surface while at the grill and not for potting, so it should be sufficient. But I can't imagine it'll last that long.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece for the price. I use this as a stand on my patio and get compliments all the time. I stained it with a darker wood stain, and a polyeurothane to match the decor and it was very easy and has held up great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Gladney

customer_reviews.title: Ok product for the price
customer_reviews.text: OK product for the price. Overall, assembly wasn't difficult - used a battery screwdriver which made it much easier. It seemed a little wobbly, so I reinforced the corners with flat L-brackets and also stained it. Meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: John & Linda N

customer_reviews.title: Simple design, works well
customer_reviews.text: This potting bench is easy to assemble and is fairly sturdy. It drains well and can hold lots of potting soil and plant pots. It works well though it's certainly not a rugged workbench. It's fine for occasional use by the average home gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent D'Amico

customer_reviews.title: This is a REALLY Good Company
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I love to cook (not garden) and prefer growing my own herbs. This bench looked like just what I wanted -- a bit rustic for Northwest Kansas, and it's not plastic -- anywhere. The holes are pre-drilled and everything, and I mean everything, lines up perfectly. And -- just the right amount of bolts and screws -- no extras "just in case" -- the exact number and that tells me this is a company that does superlative work, produces a product of which they can be proud, and are what other companies should strive to become. I sincerely hope to do business with them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Sparks

customer_reviews.title: happy customer - VERY easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: the color looked yellow to me in the picture, but is rather reddish - I would have preferred the yellowish look, but it is ok. The quality is great and what I absolutely LOVED was that they make it so easy to put it together - they could actually set the standard for other manufacturers!! - to put screws in separate bags and add the letter of the screw to identify them in the instructions - ingenious! :) Plus, the holes aligned perfectly - so putting it together was a great experience!
customer_reviews.author: J. in California

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Garden Table for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I really wasn't expecting to like the table as much as I do. It was easy to assemble, looks good, sturdy, and just flat out works. It's a really nice garden table at a good price
customer_reviews.author: ajax

customer_reviews.title: Very functional, but starting to get mold on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very functional, but starting to get mold on the surface where I have it in the shade. I was hoping the finish would resist mold.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: This item would be easy to assemble if it included clear instructions that were not printed on a single sheet of paper with faded ink. The diagrams are incomprehensible. And you're supposed to be able to assemble it with just a screwdriver, which is fine as long as the parts being assembled have the requisite pre-drilled holes, which several parts lacked.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome L. Altman

customer_reviews.title: Gardening working table
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anyone to help me to assemble it and is taking me forever to do it. Is not easy to put it together, especially to an elderly woman. I'm still in the assambling process.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Victoria Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but not water proof
customer_reviews.text: I will buy this again and water proof it. The only other drawback is that the drawer is not totally enclosed as the top of the drawer is essentially the slats of the top bench. I covered it with a colored cutting board and that seems to work. The pictures are Oct 2017 and Oct 2018 - big difference and I am in a State with very little rain.
customer_reviews.author: cf

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this bench
customer_reviews.text: I love my little bench! It’s actually much larger than I thought it would be, but that’s not necessarily a bad thing. It’s great for storage and as a plant rack. My cats also love to sleep on the lower rack in the afternoon sun.
customer_reviews.author: noneofyourbusiness

customer_reviews.title: Terrific potting bench!!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this potting bench because of the available shelves, the drawer, the slats, and the price. I wanted that bottom shelf for dirt and pots, and the top shelf for small plants. I wanted the drawer for tools, and I like the slats because the dirt falls through. The bench came unassembled, but all of the parts were pre-drilled and it was super easy to put together. The bench is very sturdy, attractive, and exactly what I hoped for. Although I chose the bench with slats so dirt would fall through, dirt does fall into the drawer as well. Some folks may not like that.
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and attractive. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and attractive plant bench! A good value for the price! I just wish that there was a solid piece of wood over the drawer. When repotting dirt falls into the drawer which makes it unusable. I solved this by putting a plastic cutting board over that section.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne A.

customer_reviews.title: Great potting bench
customer_reviews.text: I assembled without assistance. However, I didn’t notice the top and bottom shelf were different so I had to redo so pay close attn. all parts fit together and seems very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent bench for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Cute work bench. I expected it to be a little sturdier but it does wobble a bit. It was missing two screws for the lattice on back but I made it work. Has a horrible chemical smell when you first open it so take it outside. I plan on putting a coat of stain on it and water sealing it.
customer_reviews.author: Reader35

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble, my 17 year old son put it together with a cordless drill. Instructions on the leg seemed incorrect, so he flipped it around and that worked. We used 2 coats of spar urethane. It’s a little wobbly but I have it against my deck so no issues there. Great potting bench for the price as I was contemplating purchasing the $200 Suncast one - glad I decided on this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Thorn

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleasantly surprised at how easy it was for me to put together
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my Mother in law, she had been wanting a potting bench for some time. I was very pleasantly surprised at how easy it was for me to put together, and it also has a nice finish that doesn't show well in pictures online.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this potting bench
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this potting bench. The table top is at comfotable height, the small shelf on top has proved to be handy, but I decided to turn the drawer into a tray. I have placed it under my patio so that it will not be exposed to extreme weather, and it allows me to work in the shade.
customer_reviews.author: KTJohns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Outdoor Potting Table
customer_reviews.text: This potting bench/table is perfect for what I was looking for. It was easy to put together and looks great on the deck. It is the perfect height to prepare my plants and when not being used for potting it is perfect as an outdoor side board. I had intended on painting it but it has a varnish and the wood looks great as is. I may paint it after it becomes weathered. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Package came nicely packaged- several big pieces did have splits in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Package came nicely packaged- several big pieces did have splits in the wood but I coated with wood glue and clamped them til dry and then put it together. Not happy that the inside of the drawer is getting moldy even tho I covered it with several coats of poly. I still love this item and it is a pretty addition to our deck and makes potting flowers easy on the back!!
customer_reviews.author: S. MacIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price. Unlike the description, however, the wood is not natural finish - it is varnished; it would need a thorough sanding before you could paint it. I may add a coat of spar varnish for extra protection. Sturdy construction but light enough for me to move around easily.
customer_reviews.author: Loki Knows

product_meta.title: Best Choice Products Outdoor Wooden Garden Potting Bench Work Station Table w/Cabinet Drawer and Open Shelf, Natural
product_meta.description:
Tend to flowers and herbs with ease using this potting bench. Built with a large lower shelf, upper shelf, spacious tabletop, and a cabinet, it stores gardening equipment and tools all in one space. This saves precious time looking for and gathering items like gloves, seed packets, pails, pots, fertilizer, and more. Work while standing instead of kneeling down and bending over, or simply use a stool for a comfortable workstation. 

Specifications: 
Overall Dimensions: 44"(L) x 20"(W) x 45"(H) 
Bottom to Tabletop Height: 33" 
Lower Shelf Height: 22" 
Weight: 25.8 lbs. 
Material: Chinese Fir Wood 
Assembly required (with instructions)
feature_bullets: SOLID WOOD CONSTRUCTION: Crafted with strong fir wood, built to last through the seasons with proper care
BUILT-IN CABINET: Perfect for storing gardening tools like scissors and gloves, or for storing seed packets
PERFECT FOR DIY PROJECTS: The natural wood finish can easily be painted and customized to your liking, making it a perfect decor piece for any outdoor area
SPACIOUS WORKSTATION: The lower shelf is great for storing potting soil, pots, pails, fertilizer, and more, while the table provides a comfortable place to work
SIDE HOOKS: Great for hanging gardening tools or rags and towels; OVERALL DIMENSIONS: 44"(L) x 20"(W) x 45"(H)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars822 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
